content: hello crafters welcome to more space crafting today we're going to do an
airlock and this is the perfect accent to your alien tiles so well let's go to
the table will crack the airlock and then in part 2 of this video we'll paint
it up and finish it up so let's go to the table and start crafting there's
airlocks you
I started out with a strip and this is a thin cardboard strip and I'm measuring
it into two inch sections the cardboard is actually a centimeter wide so I'm
going to cut those I need four of them and I cut some crossbeams and this is a
half a centimeter wide thin cardboard I'm going to apply that to the two inch
piece this will give me my separation in the sandwich inge of the Dewar so now I
just need to finish up the frames I'm just gonna do two frames the other
pieces will sandwich to that so make sure those are applied nicely all right
now I've got some card stock and I'm cutting them into two centimeter squares
these are going to be part of the frame of the door this will help me secure the
frame together I cut those in half to make triangles I want some overlap on
the frame so that's why I made them two centimeters so I'm applying those to the
main frame in each corner almost like an old-timey picture
I'm sure that's lined up yep looking good so now yeah I need the
other piece I needed on the other side also make sure when you're doing these
you do them the right way you don't want to do it backwards you want to make sure
that they fit together like that there we go
do the same for the other frame piece all right so this is to sandwich
together and that gives me the gap that I need to have the door slide in okay so
now I'm cutting these into 1-inch pieces and these are going to go in the door
frame between the triangles to complete the door frame and make it all stand up
stick together there we go at that one piece now I'll do the other side same
thing make sure they're nice and tight square
it's all set ready to go now I got the two pieces now it's just a simple task
of gluing them together see I sandwich that so there's a gap between there at
the top and that'll be used to slide the door in now I have some corrugation on
the siding and to get rid of that so that was a quarter of an inch thick so
I'm cutting some thin cardstock that you can run through a printer it's just
yellow color doesn't matter but it painted anyway so I cut that and I'm
gonna apply it to that side to hide that corrugation I choose the white glue
because it's less messy make six great to the cardboard and cardstock secure
that cut it off sides are covered up now the door is going to be an inch and 1/4
wide and that fit so the top I'm going to do a quarter of an inch up so I have
something to grab onto to pull the door out of the frame and then I did a little
bit of edging there so that just slides right in and out
okay now I need the base so I've got it two thirds of an inch base but I'm going
to do a little detailing on the door first so I'm going to do I cut a quarter
of inch strips of cardstock and I'm gonna put that around the edge I'm also
going to do some cardstock on the top corners so I cut that half an inch and
there would be a quarter of an inch on each side and I just gonna bend it like
that bend it in half I'm gonna apply it to the top of the door now be careful
you do when you do this you don't want it to block the door but I wanted to
cover up a little bit that extra corrugation on the top there you go
we're all set now we need to finish up the that
detailing on the door so I'll just glue that down bend it over and then cut it
off and it's also here I'm working on the base and the the base is going to be
2/3 of an inch wide and two inches long you can see that fits the door perfectly
now I'm going to edge the door with this thin cardstock I'm gonna do it an eighth
of an inch thick and I'll just cut that out and apply it I used my white glue
it's a lot easier than trying to use the hot glue on this small stuff so I'll
just keep working it around so get all that edging covered up they
can see I've measured in the center of the base there okay cut the edging off
or cut that extra edging off and shore it up I measured it in the center so
I'll have a mark to put the door down and there we go just fits right in the
center just the white glue it on there and it's all good to go
now here we have the doorframe and I'm gonna take the door and just slice right
in there so I've got that sandwiched just fits right in there and one last
thing I'm going to do is use some white glue and put it around the edge and
that'll kind of strengthen a little bit just give us some extra strength there
we go it's all finished
